detailsOfAchievement: Opening of Anganwadi The notified/de-notified tribal community which is located at Okhla Modh on mehrauli-Badarpur road. We started to work with the NT/DNT families since 2014 where we mainly worked on issues of child health and nutrition. In which we found that there no any Anganwadi Centre was opened. At that time 45 (M-19, F-26) children were out of ICDS coverage. Those children were not covered under any ICDS project. Hence we sent a letter to the Department of Women and Child Development on 18-08-2014 for opening an anganwadi centre so that the children may get their entitlements. Hereafter an anganwadi centre was opened on 14th November 2014. Linking of NT/DNT Community to Primary Health Centre to access primary health care services The NT/DNT families was lesser aware about the health institution. They used to access private hospitals or quack health experts. There economic condition is not good so they cannot afford expensive health care services. Due to this also the home deliveries ratio was high. In the beginning of our work with the NT/DNT community (in 2014), we linked 5 pregnant women with the Primary Health Centre located in Lal Kuan. Thereafter we communicated with the Medical Officer to add the NT/DNT families in their area map so that the people can access better health services. The MO was agreed for the same and asked to the ANM for survey in NT/DNT area. Afterward the ANM started to visit in the area for immunization and health services at the door step of NT/DNT families. An ASHA worker has also appointed for these NT/DNT families. Immunization and Birth Registration becomes Sustainable The awareness about child vaccination in intervention areas of Matri Sudha goes back to 2003 when we started awareness and services for polio vaccination. The status of child immunization started improving over the years through sustained awareness and work with the community. Our data suggests that between 2012 to 2015, cent percent children below one year were linked with both immunization process and to get birth registration certificate. Now the major role is played by ASHA workers who are the frontline health workers in the community. 11 Nutrition Champions created to address the issue of malnutrition in community settings To find out the ways to work upon â€˜preventive and curative careâ€™ while addressing the issue of malnutrition in the community under â€˜Integrated Programme for Nutrition Improvementâ€™.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Ever since its inception in 2010, Maya For Global Peace and Serenity has been facing a paucity in funds, but the strong will of giving back to the society is what kept its founder and the other board members encouraged to keep the organisation stable with their own share of contributions. Maya distributed clothes to the poor and needy living in different parts of New Delhi. Some of the major slums and temporary settlements covered in New Delhi included Badarpur, Tughlaqabad, and Seemapuri.

This year, Maya took its distribution activities to the next level by donating a lot more than just clothes. The NGO collected not just the war clothes to make winters comfortable for the poor and needy of Delhi, but also ensured that the basic need of clothing is also taken care of. Since women and children have always been the main focus areas of the NGO, in this year, Maya distributed tea and tiffin, along with toys, to bring smiles on the faces of children living in the various slums.

In order to make the distribution of clothes a more organised activity, Maya segregated the clothes in different packages and then gave them out to the slums and temporary settlements of Delhi. Although this increased the overhead expenses, however the distribution was smoother and the amount of chaos caused on ground was much lesser—thanks to the avoidance of a situation of clambering of clothes by the people in the open. The collection of clothes this year totalled to 1000 kg.

In this year, the garment collection of Maya amounted to 100 kg alone. But that was not the only thing that the NGO gave out to the poor and needy living in Delhi. With special focus on women and children, Maya focussed on the distribution of women’s clothing, children’s school bags and toys, and shoes for all. Between the months of November and February, Maya distributed warm clothes across the city. Also, the members of Maya interacted more with the people to better understand their needs.

detailsOfAchievement: Mental Health Foundation India is a registered, not for profit organization dedicated to work for the betterment of Mental Health of people and for the promotion of mental health. The MHF promotes mental health by various means e.g. (organizing camps, workshop, seminar and conclave) and training program. As a part of the training program, MHF conducts unique internship training program for graduate and post graduate students of Psychology. The MHF also provide clinical services, comprehensive treatment to the people suffering from mental health issues. The Rehabilitation of the person with mental illness is major issues globally. To reintegrate the patients with disability into the social and occupational mainstream we extend support at every possible level to the affected person in all possible way, particularly by helping patient in getting jobs suitable to their skills and educational level. In addition we have created a supported employment model to rediscover and reintegrate lost skill of the person or to make the person skilled in new area as per the cognitive and other resources of the affected person. We also strongly believe in advocacy for mental health. We intend to protect the rights of the people with mental illness and their caregivers. The MHF submitted PIL in Delhi High Court seeking de-criminalisation of section 309 and got the positive outcomes. We conduct school mental health program to make teachers and school administration aware about the behavioral problems of the children and to educate them how to better and effectively handle the problems. MHF also provide comprehensive technical support to other institutions for conducting workshops and seminar related to mental health and hygiene.

detailsOfAchievement: â€¢ The â€˜Millennium India Education Foundationâ€™ (http://mief-india.blogspot.com) is an apex organization working for promotion, encouragement and conduction of research in all aspects of education for promoting science & technology â€¢ It is an All India Voluntary Organization equipped with specialized people from all walks of life. And in past five years MIEF has gained good experience and has been able to understand the issues related to development more keenly. Organizing Drama/Cultural Programme supported by Dte.of Prohibition, GNCT Delhi â€¢ The foundation has already successfully handled following govt.supported projects namely: o Nature Study Workshop for teachers August 2006 o Interactive Workshop For Science Teachers Using Low Cost No Cost Teaching Aids organized in July-Dec.2003 and o Science Caravan organized in Oct-Nov.2004. o Auo Mil Jhul Ke Science Ko Jaane aur Apanaye 2007 o To create a repository of all the available data on the women & adolescent girl child health issues with specific reference to anemia and Nutrition. 2007 Sensitization of Working women about their work related occupational hazards and about Doâ€™s & Donâ€™ts for its prevention- supported by DST â€¢ Besides, the other major project handled by the foundation has been: o Working with schoolchildren and teachers by organizing teacher training workshops and different competitions/ seminars/ workshops for students. o Organized Inter School competitions on the eve of World Earth Day on 22nd April 2008. More than 200 students attended it from 33 schools. The event was held in Noida. o Working in association with other NGOs by providing help in execution of their projects. (At present, the foundation is providing voluntary teachers for a school of underprivileged children run by an NGO in Noida.) o Sponsoring at least one poor student to pursue his/her education for at least one academic year (two students have been provided financial assistance till now.) o Helping professionals particularly doctor community, by educating them on management of personal finances (two annual conferences for doctors on portfolio management have been organized till date.) o Facilitating proper networking within the community by preparing database (one such directory has been prepared for Kashmiri Pandit community residing in Noida, U.P.) o Facilitating proper health care to people through MIEF Health Cards.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Though theare Has been vide spread theatre criticism in India in many theatre rich languages, seldom a comprehensive view is taken of the plurality of theatre-practice, visions and idioms, changes, innovations, rediscoveries and reinventions of many regional traditions, interface with new technologies etc. That animates the scene of India today. The need for such a critical review cannot be overstated.

Natarang Pratishthan has rare and valuable collection of handwritten, printed and audio, visual material on theatre, dance, music, literature, etc. It proposes to edit and computerize the catalogues and digitalize brochures from its rare and valuable collection. Brochures play scripts in the form of manuscripts, typed, xerox, seminar papers, audio and video recordings, photographs, posters, slides, invitation cards, clippings etc.

detailsOfAchievement: 1. National Adventure Foundation was founded by Late Brig Gyan Singh former Principal HMI Darjeeling and NIM Uttarkashi and leader of Indian expedition to Mt Everest in 1960. National Adventure Foundation is a socially oriented philanthropic NGO dedicated to promotion of Adventure Activities & Sports as a growth and development oriented positive activity among the youth of country. NAF has the privilege being accorded the status of All India Organisation under the new scheme for National Programme for Youth and Adonescents Development by the Ministry of YAS Govt of India. NAF executes its charter through its 31 Chapters and a number of affiliates. 2. NAF happens to be the only NGO dealing with Adventure in all its myraid forms i.e. on land in water and in air A Land Trekking Rock Climbing Rappeling Camping Cycle Safari Desert Trekking Snow Skiing B Water White water Rafting Kayaking & Canoeing Sea Awareness Wind Surfing Water Skiing C Air Para Sailing Para Gliding Powered Hang Gliding Micro Lite Flying Hot Air Balloning 3 Since 1979 NAF has given exposure to over 1 million Youth in Adventure Sports and Activities. Focus of NAF has been on Youth belonging to weaker section of society and women. 4 NAF has been conducting Adventure Programmes for Ministry of YAS Govt of India for last 12 years it also conducts Adventure Programmes for UGC KV Sangthan and other Educational Institutions. 5 NAF also conducts outdoor trainning and leadership and team building programmes through Adventure Sports for Schools and Collages as also for Corporate Entitites.

detailsOfAchievement: National NGO has connections with all major government hospitals in Delhi and patients are referred according to the nature of their case. Till date, we have assisted over 70 patients avail proper treatment and new cases are generated every week. Our primary areas of intervention are: Healthcare, Education, Food Security, and Empowerment. Our Healthcare programme is designed as a two pronged approach towards ensuring a better quality of life for the marginalized sections of our community. National NGOâ€™s work in the area of Education and Empowerment is complementary to each other. Major Achievement is that we are working for differently abled kids in our National Rehab Centre, also we have a primary school in place where kids from the slums of Tughlakabad pursue their studies. Another big achievement is our National Training centre where we enable visually impaired kids from various college to have the training of computer so that they can find their living from it and also we than place them in different companies and also help them get government job
